item.description:
Event Information

Tuesday, Apr 17, 2012
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM

At The French Cultural Center
Map/Directions

See event description for pricing information.
RSVP Required (call 617-912-0400)

This event is presented in English.

Event Description

Every year throughout April and May, the team behind Boston Fashion Weekfocuses on the many students graduating from fashion design programs in the greater Boston area. The French Cultural Center is excited to host a reception to showcase the work of student designers and celebrate the beginning of the fashion graduate season. Come peruse the innovative gowns from the Boston Symphony Orchestra’s 2012 Project Debussy student fashion competition and meet up-and-coming designers while enjoying French wine and cheese! Executive Director of Boston Fashion Week Jay Calderin will speak about the special focus on student designers during the Spring season.

This event is presented with the generous support of Boston Fashion Week, theBoston Symphony Orchestra and Fashion Consultant Kathy Benharris.

About Project Debussy:

Eleven talented fashion students from schools in the greater Boston area participated in the Boston Symphony Orchestra’s Project Debussy fashion design competition on February 2, 2012. For the contest, participants created remarkable evening wear inspired by the music of French composer Claude Debussy. Project Debussy is the fourth Project Composer contest organized by the Boston Symphony Orchestra.

 

Local Students: $6 / French Cultural Center Members: $9 / Non-Members: $12

Image above: Design by Project Debussy Judge’s Choice Winner Kowoon Jeong  of The School of Fashion Design
item.name: LA FASHION SOIREE - KICK OFF THE STUDENT FASHION SHOW SEASON IN STYLE!
